text: I shouldn't be surprised this place closed. Compared to the review I left last December, this place turned dismal to the point where we stopped going there.

I went to this place a couple times last fall and had no problems whatsoever.  Quick service, decent food, etc.   I went a few weeks ago and it took 20 minutes to get service.. Then another 25 minutes to get our orders. Water for all, ice tea for one, milkshake for another, and I can't remember the third right now.  Ice tea never came, milkshake was gritty cheap ice cream in a glass of milk, and third item was wrong too. Water was warm and not refilled.  Flagged down waiter (who I think is the just bought out owner) and he listened to our complaints and just said ok, then walked away. We had no idea if we were being charged, if replacements were coming, or what.  We had to have someone else get him back over to us as he was ignoring us after that. First time in my life I've never left a tip. I actually enjoy the decor... But it was crazy hot out with no air and everything felt awful and sticky.

After being seated and waiting 20+ minutes without a waiters attention , we finally got the hostesses attention and only got a "sorry someone will come soon" answer, we left. People seated after us were served before water was even offered. With all the food options in the block radius that provides the same food it's not worth going.

I mainly came in to use the bathroom but thought I'd have a snack. I saw the negative reviews so I thought something simple. Turns out it's possible to mess up making a milkshake. No, Belmont Café, a scoop of cheap vanilla ice cream in a glass of whole milk is not a milkshake. Literally it was barely even blended. Some other minor points: the interior is much less inviting than when it was Clarke's. Servers ignored me til I flagged one down - and there were literally only 3 other tables occupied. Sigh. Always listen to Yelp.

Service was slow, waited about 15 minutes for a grilled cheese sandwich.  The grilled cheese was stale, not sure if it was the bread or because it was cold.  Fries were soggy,  It has been redone since I was here last.  Atmosphere was probably bets part of the meal.  Food was much better before.  Close to the Red L stop and Belmont and Clark street bus stop close by.

There is nothing good about this place. I waited 45 minutes for pancakes that were still gooey. They shut the a/c off and it was 90+ degrees outside. Our waiter ignored me every time I tried to get his attention. This place sucks and I will never go back.
Not bad service NO SERVICE. Everyone (waitstaff AND customers) looked confused. We waited a half hour before we left.Awful place

This place is absolutely disgusting. First it honestly took them 30 minutes just to seat me because they didn't have a host however it wasn't busy so I don't understand why nobody could seat me. Next my food came out cold and had hair on it--- it was truly disgusting. Then lastly, when I complained to the manager, he asked what could I expect when they were so busy then went to the back in the most rude way. However there was only 3 other tables at the restaurant so they clearly weren't busy. Like if you're having a bad day, don't take it out on your customer.  I would not recommend this place to my worst enemy. Do not go here. You're better off at McDonald's honestly.

Thirty minutes before we ordered drinks or food. Forty minutes and counting before our food actually arrives. I'm guessing (orrrr hoping) the food is going to be fabulous because it's taking so long to make it. Can't tell you yet. The only semi saving grace is that our server who actually isn't our server is very sweet. I wouldn't come here if you are in a rush to get anywhere the same day. Especially a cubs game.

It took us at least an hour to get our food, the waiter only checked in once during that time, no apology, no nothing.  Fries were cold when the food finally arrived.  It was busy, but not packed, and there were at least 3 waitstaff working. During that hour we only saw one other table get their food, and none of the other tables had been served yet.  Came very close to complaining/walking out.  Don't bother.

Worst service ever took over 1hour never received our food. Guy said sorry I screwed up your order be up in a few minutes. 15 mins later no food but said 50% off your bill. Waited 25 more minutes still no food. We just walked out. Don't ever go.

I wanted to try this place out since its been here for a while now and always seems to be empty. The menu and prices were good. The food quality was low, coffee wasn't that good and took a while to get a refill once it was empty. The food came out cold but that could have been the fault of the server. My order was also incorrect-I ordered a skillet from the menu and the cheese was missing. When I asked the server about it she said it was inside the eggs, which it wasn't. I probably would not come back, at least for a while.

My friends and I probably waited over 45 minutes at our table and no one ever approached us. Not even for drink orders. We walked right out. I don't think I have to say that I won't ever be coming here again.

Truly terrible service. My breakfast lasted 2 hours that should have lasted only half of that. It wasn't even crowded yet could never locate my waitress or get ahold of her. The food was extremely sub-par, the pancakes tasted oddly sour. The only reason The Belmont is getting 2 stars is for location as well as portion size. I miss Clarke's :(
Mediocre. I got a chopped salad that wasn't chopped. They forgot my chicken (at first) and the chicken had no flavor. Wasn't worth the money at all.

Service is terrible.  After 15+ minutes without being acknowledged, we finally found someone to take our order.  Then it took an hour to get the food. We saw our waiter once the whole time we were there.  After drinking my coffee and 20 minutes without a refill, I took my mug over to the hostess station and tried to fill it myself. There are too many places serving the same food to bother going back to Belmont Cafe. The woman who looks like she should be running the front of the house, should concentrate on exactly that, not bussing tables. Only redeeming item was the Intelligencia coffee.

First time Visiting, we waited at the front door for 10 min to be seated we eventually just sat ourselves. I got the French toast and it was burnt and I didn't complain. The hash browns/potato was amazing I will say. Probably won't come back again.

This is the worst burger I have ever had. Inedible.  I got the Hawaiian burger thinking it sounded delicious. First, it came out way later than everyone else's meal. Second, the pineapple was not ripe enough and was out directly on the bottom bun so that when I tried to take a bit the entire bottom bun was SOGGY. Common sense that you wouldn't put the pineapple WHICH IS JUICY directly on the bottom bun. The patty had 0 flavor and was tough. The rest of the sauces were not cohesive at all. Awful awful awful. The fries weren't even good.  This place is mediocre at best. From what I heard everyone else I was with thought their meal was just okay.  I definitely don't recommend.
Service not great and way to slow. Disorganized.  Food was standard, no real complaints about that...

I decided to stop here out of curiosity after noticing it was no longer a Clark's. Unfortunately the experience was no different for me. Don't get me wrong, the food is very good and if you're in no hurry then sure I'd recommend it. It's the obnoxiously low service that earns the diner only a 2 out 5.  Most of our time there was spent waiting for someone. Waiting on them to bring us out check and cash us out took 30 minutes alone. The staff wasn't even apologetic about it. The amount of time seemed pretty common practice.  So, if you want delicious food and a nice place to chatter this is the place but you better expect to spend some time here.

I was very skeptical walking in on a weekend morning and there wasn't much of a wait for a table. Breakfast places in Chicago are typically jumping. Not here. We stood around the front for a bit and were eventually greeted and seated by a host / wait staff person.  Service was borderline dreadful. Wait staff sort of meanders around not completely certain of where they should go next or what they should be doing. I noticed several tables eager to pay and get out but no one was around to take credit cards or cash. Getting a fresh top-off on a cup of coffee seemed impossible, and food was really slow to come out of the kitchen. The place lacks urgency.  Having said all of that, the food was decent once it arrived, but the Belmont Cafe would seem to benefit from better management in restaurant operations.

I came here with my boyfriend because we had purchased a Groupon. With the Groupon, I think it was worth it. Without it, though, I don't think I would go back. The food was pretty mediocre, but I wasn't really expecting a lot because of the reviews. We first ordered a Root Beer Float, but the server said they were out of root beer. We then ordered a milk shake, but he said they were also out of ice cream, so I was getting a little annoyed. He came back after we ordered our food and said their ice cream delivery came in, so we ordered the strawberry milk shake. Not the best shake I've had. We were basically drinking ice cream through a straw. I ordered the Buffalo Chicken Wrap and it was okay, just a little dry. The menu said it came with corn, but I didn't have any in mine. My boyfriend ordered The Hangover Burger and it looked pretty awesome, he loved it. The diner is pretty cute in itself, but I probably won't go back for the food.

My Eggs Benedict was cold and undercooked, the sauce had just come out of the fridge. The hash browns had been pre cooked, and were soggy and lukewarm. The coffee was burnt and expensive. The server kept refilling my coffee every two minutes or less, often I'd just taken a sip. Like, I appreciate the attention but you can do too much. The pancakes were decent but must they be topped with powdered sugar without asking? This place makes me miss Clark's so much. The decor is half hearted, the place is drab and poorly taken care of. Won't ever go again.
If god was a chief he would eat here. Best cure for a hang over since vodka. The skillets are amazing and the coffee was awesome. I recommend this place to all who woot with the owls at night.

Went in around 8pm on a Sunday night for some food. I was with three friends, they greeted us and we sat down. Soon after, I ordered a strawberry milkshake. I figured he would come back to ask our order but he never came back and never asked how we were until we got fed up after a half hour and got the check but he made sure to ask if we wanted some dessert. NO I DIDN'T WANT DESSERT. I wanted food. Oh well, lost cause. If you go here, you may need to do the work for them.

Needed to grab a bite to eat before our 8:00 pm show across the street so we stopped in here at 7:15. We were seated right away and the menu looked decent and the food smelled good. We were served our drinks right away, water was a bit of a delay but no biggie. We placed our order within 5 minutes of walking in and it all went downhill from there. 20 minutes go by and still no food, we had ordered  a chicken salad and a veggie wrap, how long can it take? Let me just say that there were four other small tables there when we were there-2 of them had their food when we got there. By 7:45 we asked how much longer it would be a were told about 5-6 minutes. Needless to say, we left and went to our show hungry.

Ambience is really relax and casual, decoration makes it look like a modern diner. Our food, the steak sandwich and the chicken avocado sandwich weren't the best. Steak was overcooked and my chicken was bland and undercooked. Menu looked great but overall food was bad. Service was extremely friendly and quick.
The food is pretty good but takes forever to arrive and is a little overpriced.  The service is a little hit or miss.  Not one of my first choices in this area.

Went here for brunch and was really good.  I wasn't expecting much after all the bad reviews but giving this place a chance is well worth it.  It was a Sunday morning and a decent amount of people though by packed. The service was exceptional, food was great, prices were reasonable, and the inside was very clean and nice.  It is basic diner food with a good lunch menu and a good brunch menu.  This was one of those places I was very skeptical on due to other reviews so something must have changed in management or really improved.  Hope to see this place become more popular!

I really like this place! Consistently offered refills on my coffee, the food that I've gotten here has always been good and the waiters I've had have always been friendly. I enjoy coming here and will continue to do so!

For some reason...every sunday morning I wake up craving a wrap from Belmont Cafe. I usually get a bbq chicken wrap and then a side of ranch. The ranch is really good too! The food takes a little long to come out but I think it is worth it...

Had a rocky start as we had to wait for menus for several minutes, but the server eventually was very friendly. I had breakfast quesadillas with chorizo. Very tasty but I didn't enjoy the accompanying salsa. The iced tea tasted funny also. I probably should have switched to soda.

Two omelets took over thirty minutes to arrive. However, once we got our food, the waitress brought the check really quickly and came almost every two minutes asking if we were done signing it.  The waitress seemed really out of it and sometimes we couldnt understand her, as she spoke too fast, and sometimes she couldnt understand us!  Anyhow, the food was alright although the meat in the steak omelette tasted a bit stale.  Overall, it is not worth the hefty price.

Awful! The place is dirty and cheap looking with loud offensive rap music blaring. Our order was screwed up twice, although we were the only table occupied. Waitstaff is indifferent and gave the impression they didn't care about anything. The food was awful...how do you ruin breakfast? I would not recommend this place!

The environment is open and inviting. The portions for the cost are a good value. And the quality of the food is above average by a distance. I've only ever been here for breakfast, but I judge breakfasts pretty harshly due to my own ability to make some damn tasty breakfasts myself. The Belmont Cafe definitely doesn't disappoint. On top of everything they have some very lovely wait staff. All in all you're going to be hard pressed to find a better brunch spot this close to a major el stop. No complaints whatsoever!
Gross. Good was cold and super greasy. Couldn't finish anything I ordered. Won't be back.

Sadly, I can't say I was a fan. I was hopeful that something good would go in here after the previous restaurant closed because even though I loved the old place, it wasn't the greatest. They did improve the inside by renovating and doing some updates. It's brighter and more modern than it used to be. That's a definite plus. My experience: We went in rather late (11pm on a weekend, but they're open till 5 or 6am).  There were a few other tables occupied, I believe 3. Not exactly a crowd for this place. On top of that, we had two pretty simple orders; a burger, a meatball sub and an appetizer order of Mac and cheese. Unfortunately, we waited, waited, waited and waited. I'll be generous and say 35 minutes later, we got our food. I was able to pretty accurately gage it because I had a friend text me just after we ordered.  We received no explanation as to the delay, no apology or anything. Beyond that, the food was just ok. You could tell the beef in my burger was real beef, however, it was just plain as can be. Even for a burger, there's generally something done to add some flavor...nothing here. Again, nothing wrong, just blah. The whole meal was rather blah to be honest.

Meh.  This your common diner, not much to say.   The food is average, more of a breakfast spot. This place used to be PJ Clark's.   Parking is hard to find, staff is friendly, prices are comparable to any other diner in chicago.

We (two people) arrived on a Friday afternoon around 415pm and there was only one other table occupied with customers, also two people. The third table that was occupied appeared to be a manager or owner doing paperwork sitting with what looked like a cook or kitchen worker. Several tables were dirty but the customers were gone already. The host/server sat us at the table of our choice but it was dirty so we were moved to another table. She was also the only server in the restaurant. I guess it was too hard to wipe the crumbs off the table. We asked for water and coffee, the water never arrived but the coffee came fairly quickly and wasn't very hot. We didn't have silverware at the table so we flagged down the server for a spoon to stir the coffee. A few minutes later she was walking to our table with a couple spoons but was stopped by the table with the manager/owner who was talking to her for a while about who knows what when obviously she's got something to do, like bringing me my spoon. Meanwhile, we're still waiting for the spoon to stir our now even cooler coffee. We then placed our food order at around 425pm. Simple order of steak and eggs, steak cooked medium rare and eggs over easy, and am omelette, both orders with pancakes. About 20 minutes goes by and still no food. But, we did get a hot coffee refill. Another five minutes goes by and our server comes out to tell us that she's waiting for one of the orders because the kitchen didn't see the whole order but offers to bring half the order because it's been done for 10 minutes and still sitting under the heat lamp. We tell her we'll continue waiting. Another 10 minutes goes by and I'm about ready to walk out but I'm really hungry and I can only assume the food will be here very soon. After a 45 minute wait both meals come out. The steak is well done, the omelette is runny, the potatoes taste like they were cooked in burnt bitter oil, and the pancakes are chewy.  The only reason I gave two stars instead of one is because the server was pleasant. I won't be going back here again anytime soon and I imagine you won't be going because they're probably going to close soon.

My best friend and her boyfriend called me at 4 o'clock in the morning saying we should grab a bite to eat. We decided on coming here. Host was nowhere to be seen, so we sat ourselves. Our waitress was about 7 minutes late to present the menu. The time for the beverages was okay. Food took about 20 minutes to arrive at the table booth. Silverware was missing. SORRY NOT SORRY, the service was terrible! All servers are deaf or blind! I practically had to stand up and yell across the dinner(which I did) for a coffee refill. When a different server can to give me the refill; he had an attitude as if I was a picky customer.  Honestly, I could make a better server.  I don't see this "Cafe" having a bright future ahead.

Okay so this isn't Clarke's, and that's okay. If you look at this as  a stand alone diner, it's pretty good. Standard options. Relatively cheap. Quick service. I've been there multiple times, and I aways get the #4 skillet. It's everything you'd expect. This is worth the price of the meal. Nothing more; nothing less. Four stars are warranted. Sorry Clarke's enthusiasts.
Terrible service. My coffee came after my breakfast. I waited for my simple eggs 20 minutes. Will never ever come back to this place.

I'm so confused by all the bad reviews. The Belmont Cafe is basic diner food: simple and cheap. Came in on a Saturday morning for breakfast and was kind of shocked there wasn't a wait. Allison was our waitress and she was great- Constantly coming over to check on us, chat, and refill our coffee mugs. I ordered the regular French toast with a side of bacon  and the boyfriend ordered eggs, potatoes and sausage. Everything we ate was tasty. I will definitely go back.  For those whining about Clark's closing: Please Stop. Both Clark's locations were terrible and closed for a reason.
Good price, great service, my waffles were a little dry but still worth it.  Open late, breakfast served all day.

This place is no Clarke's, so don't go in there hoping that it is. I went in with a date on a Saturday night after seeing improv down the street, hoping to find a place where we could have a beer but actually have a seat and hear one another. Well, they no longer serve alcohol, so plan accordingly. We stayed and had some dessert (or breakfast as dessert) instead. My date had a freshly baked chocolate chip cookie and I had an order of french toast, and the bill didn't break $10, so no complaints about that.  The ambiance left a bit to be desired - they changed it from cheerfully run down diner to oddly minimalist black and white breakfast place. It didn't really feel welcoming or comfortable. Also, on a Saturday night it was almost completely empty, which certainly makes it feel like you are making a mistake when everywhere else on the street is plenty busy.  If I were just ranking this as a breakfast place I would give it 4 stars, because the food was good and the server was attentive. However, during breakfast hours it might be a completely different experience, since it's easier to keep your customer happy as a server when you are only keeping track of one table. But, as a late night drop in, I will not be coming back.

Where do I start with The Belmont Cafe? My boyfriend and I have visited the restaurant twice now. The first trip was below average. The food was greasy and the service was slow. We decided to give the place a second shot after we were turned away from the local Ann Sather's restaurant because of the extremely long line. What we quickly learned is that we should've sucked it up and endured the pain of the line across the street rather than suffer the atrocities of The Belmont Cafe that day. Our second visit began on a beautiful fall day. The restaurant was about one-fourth full at the time we arrived, with a large party seated next to us. It took about 5 minutes before a waitress first encountered us. It appeared as if there was only two waitresses in the entire restaurant. As a result, we decided to order immediately to speed up the process. We knew what we wanted since we had been there once before. I ordered what I think to be a simple breakfast: two egg over medium, toast, and a side of sausage. My boyfriend created his own skillet in which one of the ingredients was bacon. The waitress immediately informed us that they were out of bacon. HOW IS A BREAKFAST CAFE OUT OF BACON? HOW? It's a breakfast staple. Regardless, we additionally ordered some coffee and OJ and the waitress notified us that she'd put our order in ahead of the large table next to us. What a nice lady. From my recollection (as this visit was roughly a few weeks ago), it took 5-10 minutes to receive our coffee and OJ. She served the coffee without cream and sugar either. Our waitress would disappear for long stretches at a time, so it was difficult to flag her down for these missing items. Additionally, the OJ was served with ice cubes in it. I personally have never seen OJ served this way before. Regardless, it was bitter, sour, and not fresh whatsoever. As an avid OJ drinker, I was disappointed from the start.  After a brutal 20ish minute wait, our food was served. Apparently, the simple breakfast I had ordered was not so simple for The Belmont Cafe. The "over medium" eggs were extremely runny, the toast was not even toasted, and the sausage was rubbery. My boyfriend's create your own omelette was twice as greasy as the first time. His toast was also NOT toasted. In addition, the toast was only served with that mandarin orange jelly stuff. Where was the classic grape and strawberry?  After we decided we had had enough, we asked for the check. This was another 10 minute process as the waitress continued to disappear time after time again. Overall, this was a horrible, horrible experience and we will not be returning.

This place is weird in a sad, creepy way. My friend and I were just there for some late night snacks, all our favorite froyo places were closed and Clarke's is gone. We were hopeful about Clarke's replacement but left disappointed. The vibe is unwelcoming, the staff is rude, the lack of service made my skin crawl.  We left before we could get our food because the servers watched as a homeless man harassed the restaurant for change. It was awkward and uncomfortable, the servers also ignored us as we left. It was clear we were not welcome there.  I never plan on visiting this crapfe again.

I would give zero stars if I could. Had a crazy craving for blueberry pancakes and figured a diner would do the trick. My boyfriend and I ordered thru grub hub. I got a simple order of blueberry pancakes and a side of ham with a coke. The bf got "the Hangover" burger which boasted bacon, egg, and buffalo sauce on a pretzel bun.  We started getting mad when an hour and a half passed by and the food had not arrived. I called the restaurant and a woman with a heavy accent answered, stating "I guess so" when i asked her if my order had left the restaurant recently. When I asked for a time line, she say "I don't know maybe 5 minutes I guess?" Ooooohkay, I was definitely not expecting the best at this point.  Moments later we heard the sweet sound of the doorbell ringing. The bf returns with the bag in tow, and I instantly was put off that I payed $3 for a "coke" (it was actually RC, false advertising) in a 12oz to go cup, not a can like I was expecting because as I figured, the drink was flat.  Ok let's get to the food. My pancakes (which should have been simple enough) were soggy, cold, and plain with some blueberries scattered about and a ton of blueberry syrup drizzled all over them. They were NOT advertised that they would be soaked with artificial berry syrup and I would not have ordered them if I knew that. Oh and my $3 side of ham? I stared at it for 1 minute before I remembered I even ordered it, since I couldn't even tell what it was. Two tiny scraps of meat that I could see through.  Boyfriends burger: stale pretzel bun on a medium well burger. Granted there was no option to specify how he wanted his meat cooked, but I tell you this he wouldn't have asked for a hockey puck if he had the chance to. He opted for the sweet potato fries. They were soggy, cold, and extra salty. Mmm yummy! He said the only thing that saved the flavor of his flavorless burger was that it doused in hot sauce.  Would we have had the same experience if we dined in? Maybe. Maybe not. But I tell you one thing, I have ordered from many diners before and they were pretty good experiences and didn't take 90 minutes. I cannot believe I wasted $35 here. "The Belmont Cafe", if you don't figure your s*** out, you will end up like your predecessor Clarke's, which was, sad to say, a much much better restaurant and I will be sure to NEVER be back as well as spread the word to everyone willing to listen to me.
Hottie Jon is the best, he bussed our tables good. Love his enthusiasm and work ethic! Give that boy a raise!
Twenty minutes to get coffee.   Thirty five minutes later for omlets. Twenty minutes to run out card at the end.   Completely empty restaurant and I see why.

Tested out Belmont Cafe a few weeks ago and loved it.  The service was fantastic and food came out quick.  Had a half order of cinnamon roll pancakes and half pretzel. Both were amazing and I can't wait to go back and try more!

Okay people, overgrown teens and yuppies included, get over Clarks.  I grew up a fan of Clark and Belmont, and still never went to Clarks.  It seemed overcrowded with people who weren't doing more than drinking coffee for hours or in their for the bathroom.  I'm sure people went there to eat, but my friends didn't.  Wasn't something for me.  I want to go to a restaurant or cafe and eat, drink, and leave.  Not buy coffee at midnight trying to act cool.  What type of business is that.   So, when I noticed it wasn't Clark's anymore I was genuinely interested.  Honestly my first impression was very positive; there was a man (owner/manager/employee) washing the windows outside which I never saw before when Clarks.  A girl was waiting at the host stand when I walked by looking at a menu, which I felt was pretty inviting.  When I walked in she was ready to seat me, hand me a menu, and get me whatever I wanted to drink.  It was completely empty (people came in after me), so I felt that the service was fine.  When I worked as a server those slow times were times to hide away and steal a minute, but this staff was ready and waiting.  Breakfast all day- ummmm, yes.  I got the Eggs Benedict, a personal favorite.  It came with potatoes, and choice of toast or pancakes.  I was also handed a 10% off coupon with my water, and offered a free cookie either while waiting for my meal of after. I thought that was sweet.   When I was eating the staff seemed rather active, and a waitress who wasn't my waitress even stopped by to see if I wanted some plates cleared off.  I hadn't see my server in a little bit since there were other customer she was busy attending to, so I thought that was nice.   Any who, sorry about the yuppies comment.

Food is awful, just awful. If you need late night food in the area go to Subway. I don't see this place staying open for long....Clarkes was 100x better. Staff is great so giving it 2 stars for them...their 5 stars plus the foods 0 stars average to a 2.5 but food was so bad I can't round up...
Nice staff, nice atmosphere. Terrible service. 43 minutes for food, inattentive to table needs like coffee, water, and silverware. And then they messed up the order....twice

The absolute worst service I've ever received at a restaurant. The place wasn't even busy and I was waiting over an hour for my order, which I never received. I waited patiently and yet there were people who were seated and got their food before me. All I heard was "One more minute", "Just a few more minutes". Utterly disappointing experience. I could not disregard this place quicker.

Ouch!  It's not that awful yelpers!  Maybe we hit it at a decent time, lunch time so we missed the hungover breakfast crowd and maybe they fall apart at dinner time but our service was just fine.  It's a diner people.  Nothing more, nothing else.  They have a huge soft pretzel that is as big as Donald Trump's head so if you need a carb fix they have it.  They have meatballs too.  I love meatballs and usually you don't find them at a diner. I enjoyed their warm goat cheese appetizer and my blt was great.  Fries were hot and cold or lukewarm fries are a huge deal breaker for me so I was happy.   Great coffee too. Prices are decent, portions are legit and it's not a chain.  Stop your whining.  It's a new restie, they'll get it together and if not carry on with your bitching.

Bad enough for me to register for the first time on Yelp just to write this.   I had a sandwich and it was very bad.  Sloppy and didn't taste good.   The service was not good. Slow and they seemed kind of bored.  Unapologetic about their credit card machine not working.  They kept me hanging for about 15 minutes as they tried to start and re-start the machine (after they told me it was my card).  Had to run down the street to an ATM to get cash.  The server seemed to wander around, confused. Saw people come in and sit down and, after waiting for almost 20 minutes, got up and left.

I went here this morning to grab brunch with some friends. Not only did we wait a long time for our meal but not a single one of our orders came out complete. We had to ask our waitress three times for ketchup and then someone (not our waitress) was bringing out our food and forgetting everything. When we got our bill they tacked on several charges we were not informed about before ordering. The food was good but the service was awful enough I would never go back again.

I hadn't been to boystown in a while and was excited to go to Clark's but saw it was replaced with this restaurant. From the moment we walked in, the host was rude. Waited there for five minutes and was greeted with, "Why didn't you tell me you were there?!" I don't know, cause it's your job to notice we were waiting. We were seated and our orders were taken. The selections are reasonably priced and there was a good variety of different entrees. My food was undercooked and the fries were a pile of grease. After an hour, we still didn't get our food and customers ended up just leaving, (we ended up eating 2 hours after and I didn't even finish it). All the servers looked frazzled and it was completely unorganized. This establishment was supposed to be open 24 hours and they were turning people away. People were getting upset, and the way management handled it was unprofessional to say the least. I remember hearing remarks like, "Sorry man we are closing. We aren't serving anymore. You are gonna have to go." No apologizing, no rectifying the situation. In the end, I'll never eat at this place again. Cheesie's it is!

Came in for lunch yesterday and was thoroughly impressed! The food is delicious, I got the chicken parm, recommended to me by my server. Great recommendation, and awesome service. Thanks for that Milan! Coming back soon, and highly recommend!

My friend and I went to The Belmont Cafe today, glad we did.   Our breakfasts with buttermilk pancakes rocked.  In fact both of us couldn't finish everything so we had treats to bring home.  The price is reasonable and with the special Groupon, you cant go wrong!  A big thank you to Milan, who kept our coffee cups full while enjoying our chat today.  Looking forward to another visit soon!
The food wasn't too bad. I was hoping for a better selection in breakfast (I'm not complaining about it) although, the place was well decorative. I would consider going back again.

Decided to give the place a try today.  The place was not busy...only two other tables had customers at them. I ordered the omelette with bacon, cheddar and caramelized onions, which came with a side of potatoes and I opted for the pancakes (as opposed to toast).  First of all, the onions were not even close to being caramelized.  They were barely cooked at all.  Not a good sign...don't put it on the menu if you're not going to do it.  Also, there was a very little amount of cheese and bacon in it, and the "bacon" may have been canadian bacon...I honestly couldn't tell.  The potatoes were decent but a bit greasy, and the pancakes were good enough, but nothing I'd specifically go out of my way to order. And although there were only 2 other tables in the restaurant, my server didn't come over once during my meal to check on me.  I had to ask for my check after he walked by a couple times after it was obvious that I was finished with my meal.  I could give him a break if the place was really busy, but it wasn't.  If I'm the owner of a new restaurant that is trying to win over the new neighbors, I would stress to my servers that CUSTOMER SERVICE is #1 priority at their jobs.  Pretty disappointing.  I doubt I'll be going back anytime soon.

I'm really surprised at some of these negative reviews, though I am from out of town and am not familiar with Clarkes or whatever this place was before.  My friend and I were in town for a concert at The Vic Theatre and decided to give this cute little diner a try for dinner before the show and I'm glad we did.  Our burgers were delicious and the potatoes (he had fries and I had their breakfast potatoes) were good too.  The staff was very friendly.  I would definitely eat here again if I'm in the area.

This was my first stop in. The eggs and breakfast potatoes were delicious. The service was pretty laid back so I didn't feel rushed to eat. While the service was not super fast they were very nice and welcoming.
The food is still good, but the service was OK at best.  Before the remodel/rebranding the service was great.  Might be back.

This place is the worst. My sausage omelet didn't have a single piece of sausage in it and instead of red peppers it had tomatoes. Everything I ordered was cold. The eggs were soggy. Gross, will not be going back.

These guys can cook a good meal but the service is very slow. Have been there 3 times since they opened, since Ann Sathers can get very busy on the weekend, and the service is always slow. If they had better, faster service they could do very well considering the location and food quality.

Went for breakfast for dinner (who can pass up all you can eat pancakes for $1/piece). Pancakes were yummy, but a little dry. My bf got the grilled cheese which was pretty standard. Only memorable part was their take on iced black/red tea.

I ordered from here today and everything was awful. The eggs benedict I got was over cooked. The sauce on top looked like it had been spoiled or sitting in someone's car all day and any thing I asked to be added to my meal was completely forgotten. I even got pancakes and they completely forgot the maple syrup. I waited over an hour for this meal and the only decent thing about it was the coffee.

My biased opinion of Clarke's being gone aside, the Belmont Cafe lacks service and food quality.  We ordered two appetizers, chicken fingers and baked goat cheese, and the Mediterranean salad. The baked goat cheese appetizer ended up coming 20 minutes after the salad and chicken fingers and was essentially a giant bowl of marinara with a dollop of goat cheese on top and four triangles of bread. The salad my friend ordered had cucumbers that looked past their shelf life by color. My chickens fingers were fine, but it came with a side of goat cheese instead of ranch and the other sauces promised in the menu. The waitress said the cooks must have thought we wanted that in addition to the baked goat cheese? Makes no sense to me either. We were confused and asked the waitress for our sauces and whatever chipotle flavored gunk she brought back was inedible. On top of all of this, we were charged an extra dollar for that random side of goat cheese, which the waitress did take off when I asked her to.  The waitress has obviously never waited tables before. She was aloof and spent more time watching TV than cleaning our table of dirty plates and replenishing our coffee and water. We also asked her to split the check, a simple task that she still managed to mess up.  I'm sad Clarke's is gone and really hoped this Cafe would work, but I surely won't be going there again.

We entered this place at 2:30am. It was packed and there were a lot of people still eating. We were given menus and water five minutes after we came in. Ten minutes after we received the menu some guy came up to us and asked us: "You didn't order yet did you?"  To which we replied "No we're waiting to be served." So he says "Oh sorry about that. You shouldn't have been given menus.  The chefs are literally walling out the door." I'm very disappointed at the lack of professionalism of the staff. We were really excited to try the food...
Stopped by this place for their $1 buttermilk pancakes. But bad but not that impressive either...

Clarke's was OK. It was a good late night spot after catching a show. Belmont Cafe, however, is awful. The fries are soft and limp, sandwiches are bland (some mayo would be nice!), the French toast is not really French toast (just weird chewy toast). Won't be coming back here again!!
Good prices for a fair amount of food. One dish could easly be two meals.

This is the new Clarks and let me tell you I sure wish Clarks was still here. The food was ok but the service was not good. It took forever to get our food and our drinks. They said the back was slammed but honestly the place was not even full. It took over 45 min to get our drinks and appetizer. I don't foresee myself coming back soon.

Although I'm sad about clarkes closing, I'm glad this place is really great. I came here the other day and we got seated immediately. They were very attentive and nice. The food was seriously amazing. I got a burger and my friend got the cinnamon roll pancakes. We also split the Mac and cheese appetizer. Everything was seriously wonderful and came out very quickly. Great place and we will definitely be back!

Clarke's is gone!!!!  But wait - this isn't about me and my love for divey and gimmicky cafe's.  Belmont cafe has completely remodeled the place. It's clean and pretty. The staff is friendly but a little slow. They are still learning. I ordered a coffee and was informed they serve Intelligentsia (yes!). The food was pretty good for the price and they serve breakfast all day which is another plus in my book.  I think if they could spend a bit more time training the waitstaff to have a bigger sense of urgency this place would have more stars overall. My waitress wasn't unfriendly but I waited a long time for my bill after the plates were cleared. I had to go to the counter to get my bill. It was 12.59 and she said thank you and just stood there after taking 15 bucks from me. I had to ask her to give me my change. She then gave me two bucks and no change.  I ended up giving her a better tip at the table but please train your waitstaff not to pocket tips from the money we give to pay for our order. This is a big no no.

This was my 2nd time dining here and my daughter and I had a better meal this time for sure. We had a giant baked pretzel with cheese sauce to start. I had the steak and eggs with yummy hash browns. My daughter ate off the kiddie menu and enjoyed the chicken fingers. This place is family friendly for sure.

Thoroughly disappointing experience. The restaurant was empty when I came in at 5pm. I looked over the menu and selected the Fried Goat Cheese appetizer followed by Tuna Melt with Mac & Cheese. After waiting 25 minutes, the food began to arrive. I received my entree first and was told the appetizer was on its way. At first site, the Tuna Melt & Mac & Cheese looked very good, however, I was quickly disappointed. The Mac & Cheese was cold, or just barely luke warm. The Tuna Melt was cold as well. Another 10 minutes and my appetizer arrived. It was some melted goat cheese swimming in a bad marinara sauce. There was supposed to be toasted garlic bread served with it. I had to request the bread and was given a tiny, crisp slice with 2 pads of butter. Very disappointed. I asked for a manager and was informed that he's not there very often. After complaining about the appetizer, it was removed from my bill. I will not be returning to this establishment and would not recommend it to anyone. REVIEW UPDATE: I was contacted after my review by the Manager of the Cafe. In his response he apologized for the experience I had and offered to comp my meal on my next visit. I had said in my previous review that I would not be returning to this establishment, but now that I'm aware they still in their opening weeks, I will consider giving them another chance. Hopefully my second visit will be much better than my first one was.
Went to The Belmont for breakfast this morning, the skillet with hand cut hashbrowns was delicious and service was speedy quick. Got in and out within 30minutes, I would def recommend to a friend

The wait here is atrocious...there were only two tables when we came in, granted there was a big group of us but it took the waitress almost 20 minutes just to take our order and another half hour to get our food when the place is dead!  One person in our group didn't even get their food. And the burger was bland and not worth $11. The "sweet potato fries" were basically bright orange flavorless regular fries. A vegetarian in our group got a meat burger instead of a veggie burger.  The waitress was very nice but that was the only nice thing about this visit at all.
Try the pretzel!! It is soooo good!  Great menu options. This restaurant just opened and is in a great location. Excited to see how it grows!

Good food, horrible service. 40 minutes is WAY too long to wait for breakfast food. When it finally did arrive, the waiter told me my side of toast would be right out. About ten minutes later, he walked by our table and said, "Oh right, toast!" before finally going to get it. He had also forgotten the ketchup we asked for, and didn't seem to notice that our water was completely empty. Keep in mind there were only four or five other tables with customers at the time, so they certainly weren't overwhelmed with business. The food was good, though. I recommend getting takeout so as to avoid the painfully slow staff.

Service was negligent.   Our drinks were refilled one time over 2.5 hours.  They did not have sugar free syrup, imperative for a diabetic food plan.  Any diner that serves breakfast should have options.  They did seem to have some health conscious choices.  The new decor looks much better than its predecessor.  I might try it again, but first impression was that they weren't that concerned about giving quality service.  The restaurant was not busy at the time and there were multiple servers.  Seems like other reviewers had the same experience.  Hopefully they will find tune their approach because their location is prime and people want to eat there because of the hours and convenience to the train.

This place still has a few kinks to work out, 'cause right now it sucks at being a diner. Seated at 10:35 am on a Sunday morning, ordered at 10:45. So far so good. FORTY-FIVE minutes later, our two omelets arrived. And we weren't alone in the absurd wait - the group of dudes in a booth across from us waited about 30 minutes, got up, and left.  Food was decent (pancakes are outstanding!) but not worth the glacial pace.

The service was unbelievably slow and it took them an hour to bring our food out due to a "stove issue."  The portion size was laughable and we had to continuously ask for refills. The waiter also got our drink orders wrong and we had to request new ones.  They also forgot to put bacon on the poorly assembled mac and cheese burger and we didn't even bother to ask for it as it would've taken even longer.  The food was pretty good once we got it, which is the only reason this isn't a one-star review. However, it was not worth waiting an hour for.  I've never written a review before but this service was so remarkably bad that I felt I needed to warn others before they try it.

I really wanted to like this place. It's close to my apartment and had the promise of a local no-frills brunch place. I was supremely disappointed and will not be back. Service was horrible - 10min for coffee, 30min for food Portions were too small - Their skillet failed to even fill the skillet plate they put it in The food was subpar even for standard breakfast food The brunch competition around here is stiff, and unless they can turn this place around quick I imagine they'll be gone in 6 months

Came at midnight on a Saturday night. Service was ridiculously slow. Our server Celia seemed to want to avoid our table. She'd walk right by and we would have empty soda glasses that we had to stop her and ask for a refill.  Our food took over 30 minutes from the time we ordered, and the restaurant was not that busy. She never came and apologized for the delay. I had to ask someone else to check on our food. Also I ordered my steak sandwich medium and it came extremely well done. But she didn't come by and ask how the food was until we were almost done with the meal.  Either they train their servers or they are going to go under.

Uh. No! This place sucks. The pancakes were dry and hard. The other food was just so so. The service was very slow even though the diner was only about 1/5 full. A resounding NO! UPDATE: As I figured this business wouldn't last long. They are now closed. Clarke's really should consider coming back. It's an ideal location for dining. UPDATE 2: So a few days after my update, I'm riding past on the redline, and I see Clarke's is back in thia space. Breakfast there tomorrow!
Put simply, the food was bad. Skillet and pancakes tasted like they were microwaved. There are a lot of better brunch options around the area.

Don't waste your time. I attempted to dine at The Belmont Cafe last night with my girlfriend around 10:30.  Their posted hours said they were open until midnight so we figured we were fine.  Upon entering there was no one to greet us, so we decided to seat ourselves (they were pretty dead, so there were plenty of places to sit).  We saw one server working who was with another table, and after a few minutes he did come over to let us know he would be right with us before heading into the back of the house. After about ten minutes passed by, the server finally came back out.  He said something to another table and then went straight to the back of the house again.  Finally he emerged again a few minutes later, only to turn right back around without ever coming by our table.  At this point we had been waiting for about 15 minutes with no service, so we decided to give up and left. It's possible this server was too slammed to get to us (there were about 3 other tables seated) or it's possible he didn't feel like dealing with another table and purposely ignored us.  Either way, the restaurant wasn't properly staffed, I won't be back, and I don't think this place will last.
They must have had an off day.  45 minute wait for food that was prepared wrong. Maria the waitress was excellent. She should work at a more worthy place.
What is this marvel? A cinnamon roll pancake?  Get it and love it.  Unfortunately, They played Lynard Skynard, ew. Kept them from 5 stars.  Haiku review.

What an improvement over Clarke's! If I'm going to get boozed and turn up somewhere and make bad late night food decisions, I'd rather it be in a restaurant that's aesthetically pleasing.  Admittedly, I can't vouch for the food with a clear conscience. I was a bit too far gone at that point to be relied upon, though from what I remember I was very satisfied when I left. Alas - I'll post an update when I go again with a clearer head.

Service is great, had their skillet with ham on the bone and eggs over easy with caesar salad with homemade croutons. Everything is home based fresh produce except they buy their pancake mix... They would have received a 5 if they had made their own pancake mix.

I will never come back to this place. The food is good but the service is horrible. Only reason for the stars is the food. Right when we walked in our server was complaining to the manager or owner about how someone didn't show up and he wasn't staying but the owner disagreed and that convo happened at the hostess podium before even greeting us when we walked in.(Real professional) Therefore, the waiter was very visibly angry to be waiting on us. I understand it's frustrating when you should be cut, but don't take it out on your customers! We didn't even receive our drinks until AFTER our food came out! Which by the way, we were one of two tables and the food took pretty long to come out. I get that they just recently opened, but I will not be coming back. This place should have re opened as a fast food joint or a bar.

First of all, they took a great old diner space and ruined it with trendy accents like a huge and idiotic print on the wall that screams "EAT."  After the service and the food that we experienced, I would not go back unless I were sentenced by a judge to do so.  The waitress clearly hadn't received any training at all.  It took forever for anyone to approach our table and there was maybe one other customer in the place.  Then we waited about 10 minutes for our water.  The pretzel appetizer looked and tasted like shellacked antlers, the chicken strips were raw inside and I had to send them back, and the waitress was so incompetent that she brought us a bill that included the bacon we'd added to a sandwich but not the sandwich itself.  We were honest enough to let her know, but then she charged my friend's card twice and we had to be very vigilant to make sure she voided the second charge.  It was like being in a lost "Seinfeld" episode.  This was a truly bizarre and unpleasant experience.
Never again. Unbelievably bad. ordered food to be delivered they didnt bring the drink. They wanted me to come pick it up.

HORRIBLE!!! SO gross, I couldn't even eat what they brought me. My "skillet" was small, greasy and so disgusting. The eggs weren't cooked right, the potatoes weren't even cooked, it was just inedible. Can not believe I paid money for this. SO disappointed. Don't do it!!!

Like most Yelpers, it takes an exceptionally good or poor experience to get me to write a review. In the case of Belmont Cafe, it's the latter. It took almost exactly 40 minutes for us to receive our food on a not-packed Sunday. One item was ordered without onions and came with them. Then we had to ask twice for hot sauce. To their credit, the food and ambiance is better than Clarke's. But the prices are higher and the portions are smaller. Unfortunately, I believe this is yet another Chicago breakfast joint that falls short on service. In a zip code with plenty of options, we won't be returning.

Extremely sad with my visit today! Took a co worker out for lunch and thought we would try this place out. BIG MISTAKE!!!! The waitresses don't really seem to care to work. Checking their phones the majority of the time or gossiping to one another... Had to ask two different people for napkins.. The food was pretty bland as well. Got the Mac & Cheese burger and it had no taste at all. My co worker got the bacon turkey club and there were big pieces of meat in part and no Meat in other parts of the club.  I MISS CLARKE'S!!!!

The menu kind of sucks.  It's like they took the old diner menu, cut it in half and shrunk the portion sizes.  Music selection is odd.  Staff asks how you are 100000 times until you want a check.  They also ruined a nice vintage space and tried to make it trendy.   As for the food.. We got breakfast food. It was okay.  I didn't not add salt.   Also, take the Clarke's sign down so people don't expect something different.

Randomly stumbled upon this place after getting off the Belmont stop. The inside had a good vibe and our waitress was friendly and funny. Ordered the Hawaiian burger and a side of sweet potato fries that were bomb! Pretzel bun on the burger was awesome as well. Nice new addition to the neighborhood.

I ate at TBC for the first time and I will most definitely be back! It was a wonderful dining experience. The food was great, the waitstaff was accommodating and attentive and the location offers a fun and comfortable atmosphere. We started off with the pretzel that could seriously feed 5 people; I could have just eaten that and been 100% satisfied, but you can't only have an appetizer with so many great options in front of you. For my meal I ordered a skillet and pancakes while my dining companion ordered the brisket sandwich - we split both meals as we tend to enjoy trying everything. Both were delicious choices, cooked well and flavorful. I am anxious to try their other meal options in the future! I would definitely recommend stopping in!

Great atmosphere, comfortable seating. Bottomless Intelligentsia Coffee, king crimson iced tea, and fresh squeezed orange juice are some great options for a beverage. Great appetizers such as baked mac and cheese, swedish meatballs, or sliders. the mac and cheese burger is amazing with the hand cut fries. Also be sure to check out classic skillets and omelets which are available anytime!!! I'd stop in late night since they are open until 5am on the weekends or for lunch as they are right next to the belmont stop on the train it makes for great people watching. Hot new restaurant, I'd say check it out for sure you will have a great dining experience.  Hot tip: Order the full order of pretzel for the appetizer if you have a group its worth it, sooo good.

Just visited the The Belmont Cafe for the first time and it was amazing. You have to try the pretzel and the beer cheese sauce along with the Mac & Cheese Burger...both amazing. Great relaxed atmosphere and friendly staff...TBC will be a regular for myself and friends!!!!!

The Belmont Cafe has replaced Clarkes and I say good riddance.  The new remodel has an open floor plan and a very modern feel.  Wood, leather and metal seems to be the theme here and it works well for the space.  So far, every employee I've met has been incredibly friendly and knowledgeable about the menu.  They have typical diner fare. I wasn't super hungry so I ordered the appetizer pretzel with beer cheese dipping sauce and a side of mustard. It was delicious. I'll mention that you can order a full or half, I got the half which could easily have been shared by 3 people and was delicious.  Update: So I've been back to TBC twice since my original review and have to say the food has been pretty solid. I tried the buffalo chicken wrap which had lettuce, tomato and cheddar cheese. It was fantastic. It included fries which had sea salt and pepper. Like another person said, they could've been cooked a bit more but were still really good. Today I went again and had a burger and fries. Both were great but the fries once again could've been cooked longer and this time were missing the sea salt and pepper which was a bit of a bummer. I'm sticking with 5 stars because for a place that's only been open for two days, they are doing a great job, I've worked at several restaurants and its not easy opening month let alone opening week. Keep up the good work guys!
